newsitem.title: USA: Chancellor to buy 12 radio stations.
newsitem.headline: Chancellor to buy 12 radio stations.

text.p: Chancellor Broadcasting Co. said Monday it signed a definitive agreement to buy 12 radio stations from privately held Colfax Communications for $365 million in cash and working capital.
The eight FM and four AM radio stations are in Washington, D.C., Minneapolis-St. Paul, Phoenix and Milwaukee.
The deal, which is expected to be completed by the first quarter of 1997, will leave Dallas-based Chancellor with 53 stations in 15 markets.
Colfax is based in Minneapolis-St. Paul.
Chancellor's stock fell 75 cents to $36.50 early on Nasdaq.
